ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Re: Crawler issue
ygData.msgSnippet: hi Vaibhav, i think Adam is right. i ve also seen this (endless dots) when moving startup scripts from one machine to another. maybe indicative of a problem

hi Vaibhav,

i think Adam is right. i've also seen this (endless dots)
when moving startup scripts from one machine to another.
maybe indicative of a problem with the JVM starting up.

in one case my heritrix_out.log said:

   Conflicting collector combinations in option list;
   please refer to the release notes for the combinations
   allowed. Could not create the Java virtual machine.

turns out that i had incompatible GC options for the JVM
i was using.

the startup script could probably be improved as was
recently pointed out, so we'll look into that too.

hope that helps.

/steve@...


On 5/10/10 8:34 AM, goblin_cz wrote:
>
>
> Hi Vaibhav,
>
> it could be caused by a lot of reasons. The best way to find out why the
> heritrix hangs up is checking this log file: $HERITRIX_HOME/heritrix_out.log
>
> Hope it helps.
>
> Cheers,
>
> Adam
>
> --- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
> <mailto:archive-crawler%40yahoogroups.com>, vaibhav srivastava
> <sr.vaibhav@...> wrote:
>  >
>  > Hi,
>  >
>  > I have recently installed heritrix-1.14.3 in my system over fedora 12.
>  > However when I
>  > try to run it via the start script "$HERITRIX_HOME/bin/heritrix", it just
>  > goes in the infinite loop printing dots. I looked in the script and
> it looks
>  > like it should create the "heritrix_dmesg.log" file in $HERITRIX_HOME
> which
>  > is also not created. What could be the issue ?
>  >
>  > Regards,
>  > Vaibhav
>  >
